textos_fuente.text: Contact Us - St. Mark Coptic Orthodox Church of Cleveland 216-642-7692 church@stmarkclev.org Facebook-f Twitter Instagram Youtube Android Apple Donate Now Menu Home Events Services Schedule Registration Sheet Borrowing Library Bookstore Resources About Our Pope Our Bishop Our Clergy Our Board Our Coptic Orthodox Church Our History Contact Us Watch Live Close Search for: Menu Home Events Services Schedule Registration Sheet Borrowing Library Bookstore Resources About Our Pope Our Bishop Our Clergy Our Board Our Coptic Orthodox Church Our History Contact Us Watch Live Close Search for: Donate Now Contact Us Home | About | Contact Us Ways to reach us Want To Get In Touch? Contact the church via phone, email, or fill out the form. Visit Us: 2100 East Pleasant Valley Road, Seven Hills, OH, 44131 Email Us: church@stmarkclev.org Phone Us: +1 (216) 642-7692 Send Us Message Complete the contact form below and someone will get back with you soon. Name (Required) First Last Email (Required) Enter Email Confirm Email Phone (Required) Message (Required) Please let us know what's on your mind. Have a question for us? Ask away. Welcome! We are glad you have chosen to spend a few moments looking around, discovering our church family. To fully understand us and our Orthodox tradition, come to a Divine Liturgy or to a Bible study, ask questions and feel the up-close, in-person fellowship that comes when people share time together in the presence of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ and united in the Holy Spirit. Contact Us 2100 East Pleasant Valley Road Seven Hills, OH 44131 Phone: (216) 642-7692 Fax: (216) 642-7693 Email: church@stmarkclev.org Facebook Twitter Instagram Youtube Android Apple Quick Links Watch Live Our Events Borrowing Library Bookstore Donate Now SMS Terms and Conditions Â© All right reserved 2025 St. Mark Coptic Orthodox Church of Cleveland â€”Â  Developed & Maintained by Faith Web Solutions

Summer at Journey Messages Give LiveStream Leadership Team New Here Find Us Plan a Visit Leadership Team Journey Church Staff Team Scott Edinger Lead Pastor scott@journeysherwood.org Olivia Pothoff Pastor of Worship & Care olivia@journeysherwood.org Gabe Nielsen Director of Journey Youth gabe@journeysherwood.org Olivia Cuddeford Director of Journey Kids oliviac@journeysherwood.org Journey Church Leadership Board The Leadership Board at Journey Church is made up of six members of the Journey Church family and the Lead Pastor. They are assigned to help guide, equip, and empower the pastors and staff at Journey Church to fulfill the mission and vision that God has uniquely given us. Our current Leadership Board members: Megan Oâ€™Connell, Jon Burgi, Lacey McNay, Ed Hatch, Amy Schlapper, Josh Thoreson. If you have any questions for the Leadership Board please email: leadershipboard@journeysherwood.org Back to Top Events Messages FOLLOWING JESUS TOGETHER Phone 503.610.0759 Email info@journeysherwood.org Gather 22689 SW Pine Street, Sherwood, OR Mail PO Box 322, Sherwood, OR 97140 Subscribe To Our Weekly Update Sign up with your email address to receive our weekly email updates. First Name Last Name Email Address Sign Up We respect your privacy. Thank you for signing up for our Weekly Update!

Saint Mark Greek Orthodox Church in Boca Raton, FL Skip to content Live Broadcast Calendar Home Ministries Youth Ministries Acolytes (Altar Boys) GOYA (Grades 6-12) Greek Language School JOY (Grades K-5) Mommy + Me Myrrhbearers Oratorical Festival Summer Camp Sunday Church School Youth Dance (Syrtaki) Parish Ministries Parish Council Philoptochos Koliva Ministry Caring Kitchen Outreach Adult Education | Catechism Archons of the Ecumenical Patriarchate AHEPA Bereavement Ministry Book Club Bookstore Chanting Ministry Daughters of Penelope (DOP) Family Promise Ministry Homebound Ministry Live Streaming Ministry Prayer Team Prison Ministry Prosfora (Holy Bread) Saint MarksMEN Ministry Usher Ministry Welcome/Greeters Young Adult League (YAL) Young @ Heart Stewardship Endowment Fund Sacraments 40 Day Blessing Baptism Confession Good Standing Letter Marriage Memorials Media/News Live Broadcast Sermons | What We Believe Video Archive Worship Guide Lionâ€™s Heart Blog Events Greek Festival About Us First Time Visitor Mission Statement Our Patron Saint FAQâ€™s About The Orthodox Church Our Clergy Our Staff Contact Give Today Welcome Slide Welcome To SAINT MARK GREEK ORTHODOX CHURCH Plan Your Visit Candle LIGHT A CANDLE Let us include you in our service by lighting a candle and praying for you Virtual Candle Stewardship Ministry Stewardship Ministry Stewardship is making a commitment to Christ of ourselves in support of the ministries of His Church. Time, talent and treasure are all ways in which we express our service to Christ. Orthodox Christian Stewardship is a way of life, which acknowledges accountability, reverence, and responsibility before God. Learn More Stewardship HEAR FROM A FEW OF OUR PARISHIONERS Stewardship is making a commitment to Christ of ourselves in support of the ministries of His Church. Time, talent and treasure are all ways in which we express our service to Christ. Orthodox Christian Stewardship is a way of life, which acknowledges accountability, reverence, and responsibility before God. Learn More Get To Know Us Welcome to Saint Mark Greek Orthodox Church. Click here to learn more about our Faith, mission and ministries. We look forward to welcoming you to our Saint Mark Family. Sermons Click here to listen to some of our sermons offered by the Clergy of Saint Mark. We hope and pray that they will inspire you to walk in this life with our Lord. Upcoming Events Click here to learn about our upcoming Saint Mark Church events. We are blessed with opportunities to come together in fellowship and grow closer to each other and our Lord. Giving Click here to make a donation or pledge; give to one of our many outreach opportunities that enable us to be the presence of Christ in our world. Boca Raton, FL Welcome to Saint Mark Greek Orthodox Church We are a pillar of Orthodox Christianity in South Florida,Â nurturing, strengthening, transforming and sharing our Faith in Jesus Christ, â€œglorifying God by loving one another as Christ loves us.â€ John 13:34 Learn About Us Upcoming Events All event times are in Eastern Standard Time (EST) Thursday - 09/11/2025 (Cancelled) Young @ Heart Game Day 1:00 pm - 4:00 pm Friday - 09/12/2025 Greek Language School 4:00 pm - 7:00 pm Saturday - 09/13/2025 Myrrhbearers Meet and Greet (Required) 10:00 am - 11:30 am Sunday - 09/14/2025 Orthros (Morning Prayers) 8:30 am - 9:45 am Divine Liturgy: Exaltation of the Cross 9:00 am - 10:00 am View Full Calendar Recent Sermons View Our Sermon Gallery Our Ministries Acolytes (Altar Boys) View Ministry Adult Education | Catechism View Ministry AHEPA View Ministry Archons of the Ecumenical Patriarchate View Ministry Athletic Club Ministry View Ministry Bereavement Ministry View Ministry Book Club View Ministry Bookstore View Ministry Caring Kitchen Outreach View Ministry Chanting Ministry View Ministry Daughters of Penelope (DOP) View Ministry Family Promise Ministry View Ministry GOYA (Grades 6-12) View Ministry Greek Festival View Ministry Greek Language School View Ministry Homebound Ministry View Ministry JOY (Grades K-5) View Ministry Koliva Ministry View Ministry Live Streaming Ministry View Ministry Mommy + Me View Ministry Myrrhbearers View Ministry Oratorical Festival View Ministry Parish Council View Ministry Philoptochos View Ministry Prayer Team View Ministry Prison Ministry View Ministry Prosfora (Holy Bread) View Ministry Saint MarksMEN Ministry View Ministry Stewardship Ministry View Ministry Summer Camp View Ministry Sunday Church School View Ministry Usher Ministry View Ministry Welcome/Greeters View Ministry Young @ Heart View Ministry Young Adult League (YAL) View Ministry Youth Dance (Syrtaki) View Ministry View All Parish Ministries View All Youth Ministries Stewardship Caring for The Needs of Others Become part of our family and learn about us as we learn about you! Becoming a Steward gives your family the ability to know everything going on at our Saint Mark Community. You will get newsletters, email blasts and other notifications of every event surrounding our Church Community. There are many benefits to enjoy! Let us become one together moving forward. Begin Your Pledge Today Saint Mark Greek Orthodox Church Address & Contact Information 2100 Yamato Road Boca Raton, FL 33431 561.994.4822 office@saintmarkboca.net Office Hours: Monday-Thursday: 9AM-5PM Service Hours Sunday Services: 8:30 AM Orthros (Morning Prayers) 9:45 AM Divine Liturgy Weekday Services: (According to Calendar) 9:00 AM Liturgy - Weekday Join Our List Please enable JavaScript in your browser to complete this form. Online Chapel Saints, Feasts, and Readings for 09/11/2025 Theodora of Alexandria Today's Readings St. Paul's Letter to the Galatians 1:1-3, 20-24; 2:1-5 John 12:19-36 Saints and Feasts Commemorated Theodora of Alexandria; Euphrosynos the Cook; Demetrios & Evanthea the Martyrs & their son Demetrianos; Sergius and Herman of Valaam, Finland; Afterfeast of the Nativity of the Theotokos; Deinol the First Bishop of Bangor Visit the Online Chapel for more daily readings, hymns, a monthly calendar of saints and feasts, and more.
